title.narrative: ACCESS TO WASH FACILITIES

description.narrative: Facilities for safe drinking water and adequate sanitation are available to vulnerable people in the target areas

sector.narrative: Institutional strengthening/policy support/advocacy/education on integration of climate change concerns
Risk management and resilience/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

related-activity.ref: 0690/A0/05/884 USE OF WASH FACILITIES AND ADOPTION OF GOOD HYGIENE PRACTICES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Facilities for safe drinking water and adequate sanitation are available to vulnerable people in the target areas

description.narrative: Access to safe drinking water in targeted areas has increased by 0.4% over the reporting period leading to a total of 3.5% increment since 2018. Access to improved latrines has increased by 0.7% in schools and remained unchanged (Current result achieved at the beginning of the year is 18.4% over 15% target at the end of 2020) in health care facilities. Notwithstanding this situation, support is being provided to continue improving the sanitation in schools, in health centers, among displaced population and along the COVID19 response in most affected areas including urban and peri-urban areas | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Number of communities certified open-defecation free
Number of schools supported by UNICEF during the year of reporting with separate sanitation facilities for boys and girls
Number of additional people living in the newly certified Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities as a result of UNICEF CATS programming during the year of reporting
Proportion of people with access to a safe drinking water source in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Number of schools with access to basic WASH service in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
Health centres (clinics, hospitals, etc.) equipped with WASH facilities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
